page.title: 05COLN VALLEY MILLS
page.content: Sites of mills using water power have remained the same since Saxon times, although the buildings have been altered or replaced. Winson has had a mill since Saxon times and it is recorded in the Domesday Book. It was used for grinding corn and included a miller's house in the 19. Century. In 1882 it was still in use as a mill but was abandoned in 1912. It has since been converted to a dwelling house. A cornmill was in operation in Ablington before the 19. Century. It ceased grinding flour early this century but continued to be used for generating electricity for Ablington Manor until the public electricity supply was laid on. All the machinery has been removed and the mill converted to a dwelling house.
